thread.title: Lady Gaga's Super Bowl home rents for $10k per night | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga's Super Bowl home rents for $10k per night | Daily Mail Online

author: Ryan Smith
title: Lady Gaga's Super Bowl home rents for $10k per night | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Impeccably and tastefully decorated throughout, the home features well presented bedrooms, a number of which enjoy breathtaking marble-accented en suite bathrooms. The home proved to be the perfect launch pad for the 30-year-old star - real name Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta - who took to Twitter after her stage performance to announce her world tour. Resort style: Among the luxury home's many features are a glistening pool worthy of a top-class resort Perfect place to rest: The home features five well-appointed bedrooms, many of which enjoy extra-large en suite bathrooms Tastefully decorated: The property is tastefully decorated throughout, looking comfortable despite its large size Grand designs: Marble-accented bathrooms are among the features of the house, which is 10,000 square feet in size Taking a dip: As well as oversized shower cubicles, the bathrooms also feature deep baths, should guests fancy a soak She kept the announcement very simple by posting a .GIF featuring her with circular shades that had 'Joanne' flashed across them. Her blonde locks were worn down and dishevelled as she accentuated her natural beauty with a swipe of shiny pink lip. Gaga is no stranger to the road as this will be her sixth tour in her near decade in the spotlight. Her last tour was from late 2014 through August 2015 as she was on the Cheek To Cheek Tour alongside legendary crooner Tony Bennett. All the way up: The house benefits from dramatically high ceilings, opening up the luxurious spaces even futher Life is a movie: A movie theatre with leather recliner chairs is available for an extravagent night in at home Indoor, outdoor: The property's outdoor and indoor spaces are well married, while fireplaces are scattered throughout It'll put a hole in your pocket! The Texas home is rented out to monied guests for an eye-watering $10,000 per night Perks of being famous: While guests normally fork over $10,000 per night to stay there, Lady Gaga got the home for free Making a meal of it: The large kitchen included a grand breakfast bar - perfect for entertaining large numbers of guests No doubt she was trying to strike while the iron is hot as she was highly-praised for her high energy 13-minute performance during the big game. People of stature from Katy Perry to Hillary Clinton even chimed in on social media with their rave reviews. Katy, 32, actually performed in the spot back in 2015 wrote: 'I want jumping gifs stat! Bravo @ladygaga.' Bruno Mars has also been a featured performer in recent years as he wrote: '@ladygaga you killed that!!!!' In good company: Lady Gaga joins the likes of Beyoncé and Justin Bieber in landing luxury stays through Airbnb Time on her hands? It's unlikely that the star had much time to fully enjoy the property, as she prepared for her performance Fine dining: The grand dining room features an imposing table with matching padded, patterned chairs and chandeliers Working on her fitness: The pop superstar also had access to the state-of-the-art gym, which even boasted a sunbed Cleaning up: To sweeten the deal, luxury toiletries are placed throughout the home for guests' convenience Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton wrote: 'I'm one of 100 million #SuperBowl fans that just went #Gaga for the Lady, & her message to all of us.' Many admired Gaga for not making politics the focus of the show. Ivanka Trump also chimed in writing: 'Incredible performance by @ladygaga #PepsiHalftime #SuperBowl.' Lady Gaga released her fifth studio album Joanne in October - which was her fourth to reach number one in the US - and no doubt will be heavily featured in her upcoming tour. more videos
